sentences: Nicholle "Nikki" Jean Leary (born August 25, 1983) is an American singer-songwriter and occasional actress from St. Paul, Minnesota.
section: N/A

sentences: Aside from her solo career, Jean was once a part of the Philadelphia-based music group Nouveau Riche.
section: N/A

sentences: She first gained major recognition in 2008, when she was featured on Lupe Fiasco's single "Hip-Hop Saved My Life", from his second album The Cool.

== Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Early life and career beginnings ===
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Nikki Jean was born on August 25, 1983, in St. Paul, Minnesota, United States.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She moved around with her mother spending time in both South Dakota and Minnesota.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She ended up attending High School in both St. Paul, Minnesota, United States and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: During her years as a child actor in the Minneapolis theater scene, she spent two years under the musical tutelage of JD and Fred Steele.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The Steele family are pillars of the Minneapolis gospel scene and were back up singers for Prince, and she credits them with her sense of harmony and vocal arrangement.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She attended college early and graduated from Howard University with a degree in Sociology.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: While at Howard University, she was invited to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and would soon join the band Nouveau Riche as the lead singer.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In Philadelphia, she began posting music online.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: As her fanbase grew from the acoustic music she posted on, producers Chris & Drop discovered her and reached out.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: They would in turn introduce her to Lupe Fiasco while he was working on his second album The Cool.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: She would write the hook and feature on Hip-Hop Saved My Life and guest feature on "Little Weapon".
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: On the day The Cool was released.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: Nikki uploaded a video of her opening the CD for the first time.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: The video exploded online and she was subsequently interviewed on CNN.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: Philadelphia and Lupe Fiasco ===

sentences: From April 16, 2008 to August 6, 2008, Nikki Jean was part of the Glow in the Dark Tour with Kanye West, Lupe Fiasco, Rihanna and N.E.R.D.

sentences: Pennies in a Jar =
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===
== Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: While on tour Nikki Jean was introduced to producer Sam Hollander and the two came up with an idea for a concept album based around Nikki Jean's songwriting ability.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: She would travel the country writing with some of America's best songwriters.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: Nikki Jean co-wrote each song with a writer in the Songwriting Hall of Fame.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: In the process Nikki wrote with over 30 hall of fame songwriters including Thom Bell, Luigi Creatore, Lamont Dozier, Burt Bacharach, Jeff Barry, Carole King, Bobby Braddock, Paul Williams, Jimmy Webb, Barry Mann and Cynthia Weil, Carly Simon and Bob Dylan.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: The Concept was shopped to a few labels and she eventually signed with Columbia Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: Although they liked the concept Columbia decided not to release the album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: The album Pennies in a Jar, was released on July 12, 2011 on S-Curve Records/Universal Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: Lupe Fiasco returned the favor by appearing on the album's second single "Million Star Motel", alongside Black Thought.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: She was invited to open for Mayer Hawthorne, on his nationwide concert tour.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: Her single "My Love" reached number eight in Japan on Hot 100 Singles chart and she toured Japan and Australia in support of the project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===

sentences: On July 14, she performed "How To Unring A Bell" on the Late Show with David Letterman to promote her album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2012: Pennies in a Jar ===
== Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===
== Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: Surgery and Champagne Water
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===
== Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: While recording Pennies in a Jar, Nikki Jean realized it was getting harder to sing every night on tour.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: When she returned to Philadelphia she was informed by her doctors she had nodules on her thyroid.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: While they were not cancerous they did affect her ability to maintain her vocal training.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: She decided to have a Thyroidectomy at Johns Hopkins University.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: Utilizing a brand new nerve sensor, the doctors were able to remove the thyroid and nodules without damaging her vocal chords and associated nerves.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: With brand new control over her voice Nikki Jean set out to complete her next project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: She moved to Los Angeles, California and ingrained herself in the burgeoning scene there.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: She has since collaborated with Ab-Soul on his critically acclaimed These Days... and was featured on Lupe Fiasco's new album Tetsuo & Youth, on the tracks "Little Death", "No Scratches", and "Madonna (And Other Mothers in the Hood)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: On October 22, 2014 Nikki Jean released "Champagne Water", the first single off her Champagne Water EP.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: It features a guest verse from Ab-Soul.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: Upon release it skyrocketed to the top of the Billboard Magazine Real Time Charts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: Vibe Magazine online premiered the new EP by Nikki Jean on November 19, 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: It is also available for free download on her personal website.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===

sentences: The project features collaborations with Ab-Soul, Kevin Olusola (Pentatonix) and includes production from Donnie Trumpet, Nate fox, Peter Cottontale, Like (Pac Div) and double-0
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2014: Surgery and Champagne Water ===
